We're only one day away from our 2020 virtual Teppies!

This morning we are celebrating and out-of-this-world teacher, Kristen Hecker as the Elementary School Teacher of the Year from Clairton Elementary School.

Kristen is known for being a stellar 2nd-grade teacher. Her peers say that "since she joined the staff at Clairton several years ago - she is always looking for innovative programs to bring to her class and to the entire 2nd grade".

She is known for bringing in special guests to the district to speak to the students about technology and different careers including zoologist, NASA, a meteorologist, and more.

Another peer stated that "she teaches her students that your success is not based on your current circumstances and to shoot for the stars".

Congrats Kristen for your amazing job as an educator. Join us right here on a Facebook live on Thursday at noon to celebrate this star teacher!

📚Back to School 2020 looks a lot different for students across the country.
Here's what one Pittsburgh-area mother did to help her daughter get ready for -- and excited about -- the upcoming school year: she transformed this room to make it feel more like a classroom.
"I wanted Kassidi to get excited about this school year even though things are different. I also wanted her to have her own quiet space with no distraction so she will be able to focus on her school work." Kendall Knowell's daughter Kassidi will be entering the first grade at Clairton Elementary School -- taking classes virtually.
Her mother says, "My hopes are for her, to have fun while she's learning and not feel as if she's missing out on something because she's not in school."

We wish Kassidi and all of the other students, teachers and staff members around the Pittsburgh-area and beyond -- the best of luck this school year!

Congratulations to Clairton City School District named as a recipient of the 2020 Best Communities for Music Education Award.

The NAMM Foundation’s Best Communities for Music Education (BCME) is a signature program of The NAMM Foundation that recognizes and celebrates school districts and schools for their support and commitment to music education and efforts to assure access to music for all students as part of a well-rounded education.

The BCME award is for a district to be acknowledged that serves students across grade levels and multiple schools.

The SupportMusic Merit (SMMA) award is for an individual school to be acknowledged. It is a “school-only” distinction and can be a charter, private and parochial school seeking the designation.

The Bears are going to Heinz Field but before they punched their ticket to the championship several players and cheerleaders went to the 2nd grade to participate in the monthly 2nd & 7 Foundation Program. This months story was "The Hog Mollies and the Camp Carmen Campfire.”

Across the country, The 2nd & 7 Foundation has donated over 400,000 books to kids in need since it started in 1999. During the 2017-18 school year, over 170 programs were implemented in 23 states, with over 67,000 new books distributed to children in need by positive role models from high schools and universities throughout the country. 12 times during the school year student athletes from Clairton High School will visit and read to the 2nd grade. They will discuss the story and each student in the 2nd grade will receive a copy of the book the student athlete read to them. At the end of the year each 2nd grader will have a complete set of 12 books.

Clairton City School District participated in the Great American Shakeout Earthquake Drill this morning (10/17 @ 10:17 AM).

The following announcement was made at approximately 10:17 AM:

This is the Great Shakeout, one of the largest earthquake drills ever. Practice now so you can protect yourself during a real earthquake.

Everyone needs to DROP, COVER. AND HOLD ON.

DROP to the floor now.
During a large earthquake, the ground might jerk and jerk you. You can be prepared by already dropping to the ground.

Take COVER under something solid.
You can be prepared by protecting yourself from objects that can be thrown around.

HOLD ON until the shaking stops.
If you canʼt get under something, stay low and protect your head and neck with your arms.

Thank you for taking part in the Great Shakeout!

THE 2ND & 7 FOUNDATION
Across the country, The 2nd & 7 Foundation has donated over 400,000 books to kids in need since it started in 1999. During the 2017-18 school year, over 170 programs were implemented in 23 states, with over 67,000 new books distributed to children in need by positive role models from high schools and universities throughout the country. 12 times during the school year student athletes from Clairton High School will visit and read to the 2nd grade. They will discuss the story and each student in the 2nd grade will receive a copy of the book the student athlete read to them. At the end of the year each 2nd grader will have a complete set of 12 books. The first reading took place on 10/7/19 when the Varsity Cheerleaders joined the 2nd graders.
